concept.title: Branch filtering
concept.shortdesc: The branch filtering mechanism allows map authors to set different filtering conditions for different branches of a map, enabling the production of single deliverables that reflect different values for the same conditional attribute.

conbody.p: DITAVAL documents provide a way to specify a set of conditions that are used to conditionally process DITA content. While these conditions are often stored outside of the content and applied globally by a processor, the ditavalref element can be used to reference a DITAVAL document in order to filter only a subset of content within or referenced by a map. This also provides the ability to process a single branch of content multiple times, applying unique conditions to each instance of the branch.
In addition to filtering, applications MAY support flagging at the branch level based on conditions in referenced DITAVAL documents.
